primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from abandonment and death (famine/widowhood) to redemption and life through the agency of human kindness as the 'incarnation' of God's covenant love.

subject.identificatie: Human Actors (Ruth and Boaz) as agents of God.
tekstueel_bewijs: Ruth proposes, fearlessly, to go into the fields
Boaz goes to her and says...
Boaz himself lives his life... in the sight of God
The loving-kindness of God... has been shown forth humbly, simply — one human being reaching out to another.
a hope of redemption for herself and her dead husband’s legacy
He shall be to you a restorer of life
The Lord has lifted the famine
the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge

ontvanger.identificatie: Naomi and the family line (ultimately the world via Jesus).
tekstueel_bewijs: Blessed be the Lord, who has not left you this day without next of kin
the Redeemer of the whole world
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver of kindness or the potential Subject of 'reaching out'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the covenant love of God is made known through the simple, human actions
helper.rol_van_god: God is the hidden Subject who acts through the human Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help manifesting in human character.

tegenstander.identificatie: Famine, Death, Sexual Menace, and the perception of God's absence.
tekstueel_bewijs: the hand of the Lord has gone forth against me
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad luck, but the 'extinction of the family name' and the existential threat of a 'hostile' God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to imitate the kindness of Boaz and Ruth.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Acts of kindness to the stranger/neighbor
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon argues that when humans act (Secondary), it is actually God acting (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has lifted the famine
God had prepared [good works] for her to walk in
voorbeelden_mens_subject: When you reach out your hand

voorbeelden: it was not an obligation laid upon her
Ruth, we are told, refuses to leave
Naomi discerns that in the person of her relative... there is a hope
the wing of God is incarnate in the 'wing' of Boaz

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God manifesting through human agency. It moves away from 'Must' (Devoir) toward 'Gift'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Naomi's despair) through ~S2 (Ruth's initiative) to S1 (God's redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by identifying human kindness as the literal presence of God's wing.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes the reality of famine and 'sexual menace'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While humans are the primary actors in the narrative retelling, the preacher explicitly re-frames these actions as the work of God. It avoids moralism by stating that Ruth's actions were 'good works that God had prepared'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Boaz is deeply impressed by Ruth’s bravery and devotion.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the source of human ability
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: When you reach out your hand to another, it is the hand of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Ruth and Boaz are models, but they are models of 'God's agency' rather than mere moral willpower.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by linking Boaz to Christ as the ultimate Go'el.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and empowerment to act, knowing God is the power behind the act.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where God is the primary mover.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Excellent integration of the Old Testament story with the New Testament fulfillment in Jesus.
spanning_punten: The transition from Boaz's human attraction to Ruth to his role as 'God's agent'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: His covenant love appears in human form — in the flesh.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: God gives the 'Pouvoir' to act kindly.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High: Sin is seen in the 'extinction of the name' and 'famine'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully makes God the 'Sender' and 'Subject' of the deep structure, even while humans remain the 'Subject' of the surface narrative.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that Ruth's 'refusal to leave' was a gift of the Spirit.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's redemption) clearly grounds the Ethics (human kindness).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in showing how God's providence works through human 'Hesed' without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'short story' charm, Greimas reveals the 'Redeemer' as the functional engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Go'el custom; Greimas shows how the Go'el functions as the Subject that resolves the lack (Object).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that Boaz is not just a character but a 'Modal Helper' who provides the 'Pouvoir' for Naomi's survival.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's own principles of 'God as Subject' effectively by the end.
